statement.p: Imagine that you hold the handle (i.e. stick") of the paddlewheel in the figure steady and let the blades be pushed by the fluid represented by the vector field.

If the stick is in the direction \displaystyle{<}{0},{1},{0}{>}Â would the paddlewheel spin? Rotate your view of the vector field and paddlewheel so that you get a clear view that helps you decide. Remember that your eye is at the top of the stick.
Now change the direction of the stick to \displaystyle{<}{1},{0},{0}{>}. What happens?

ul.li: B: The paddle would spin clockwise.
